unlockPuzzles.puzzle: I am the art of making, combining elements anew. What am I?
I dance and glow, bringing warmth and light through the night. What am I?
I have a head and a handle that fits, to chop and split I'm hard to beat. What am I?
I protect you from the elements, a haven from the storm. What am I?
I'm sharp and handy, cut and slice, in survival I'm worth my price.
I have a point and a rocky mission, breaking through stone is my ambition.
With seeds and soil, sun and rain, I help your food to grow again. What am I?
Deep in the earth, I'm built with care, to bring up something vital and rare. What am I?
I'm long and thin, with a hook at the end, I help you catch dinner, I'm your aquatic friend.
I'm hot inside, turning soft to hard, with me you can shape clay, I'm a crafter's card.
Threads intertwine, as I work back and forth, creating fabric fine, I prove my worth.
Fire burns hot, metal bends to will, I shape the future, with hammer and skill.
Leaves and roots, I know their use, to heal the sick, my knowledge I produce.
I stand tall and see far, guarding day and night, from my peak, everything's in sight.
Walls and roof, I keep things dry, your goods within, safe and spry.
Trees in rows, bearing sweet delight, I grow your food, from dawn to night.
Hides I treat, with skill and care, turning skin to leather, strong and fair.
Words on pages, knowledge stored, in my halls, wisdom is explored.
With wheel and hand, I shape the clay, creating vessels for use each day.
In forest deep, I track and stalk, to bring back meat, on which we'll not balk.
I dig deep into the mountain's heart, to bring forth riches, stone and ore to impart.
Shuttles fly, threads entwine, creating fabric, line by line.
Potions and tinctures, I brew with care, to cure the sick and health repair.
Goods are bought and sold with glee, in this place of commerce and trade you'll see.
Blades whir and timber falls, transforming trees to planks for walls.
Young minds gather, to learn and grow, in this place of learning, knowledge to sow.
My arms reach high, catching the breeze, grinding the grain with the greatest of ease.
Gazing at stars, secrets unfold, in this tower of science, discoveries bold.
From sand to liquid, then cooled with care, I create clear panes beyond compare.
Bubbling vats and aging casks, I create drinks for all tasks.
With hammer and anvil, I shape the ore, creating tools not seen before.
Tall and round, I stand with pride, keeping the harvest safe inside.
Spinning wheels and clattering looms, I weave fine cloth in many rooms.
Quills scratch and pages turn, preserving knowledge for all to learn.
Bubbling flasks and smoky air, I seek truths both dark and fair.
By river or sea, my creations sail free, bringing wealth from lands across the sea.
Halls of learning, minds alight, I push the boundaries of wrong and right.
Towering high for all to see, I mark achievements of our society.
Channels and pipes, I guide the flow, helping crops to thrive and grow.
Tall I stand by waters deep, guiding ships while others sleep.
Pulp and press, sheets so fine, on me your words will soon align.
Metal discs I stamp with care, creating wealth beyond compare.
Arches high, water flows, bringing life where'er it goes.
On my stage, stories unfold, entertaining young and old.
Through me gaze at stars so far, unlocking secrets of what they are.
Letters arranged in lines so neat, I make copies quick and fleet.
Melodies and harmonies resound, bringing joy to all around.
Gold and silver, notes and coins, I guard them well in secure loins.
Justice served with balanced scales, here the law never fails.
Wheels turn and belts convey, producing goods day by day.
In my wards, the sick find care, healing hands and knowledge rare.
Turbines spin with mighty force, providing power from nature's source.
On iron rails I swiftly glide, carrying goods from side to side.
Bulls and bears, they come and go, as numbers rise and fall in show.
Step by step, piece by piece, production speed I will increase.
In test tubes and under microscope, I seek answers and foster hope.
Towers high and streets so wide, a bustling hub where millions reside.
Beyond the sky, to stars we fly, in metal birds that pierce the sky.

events.name: Bountiful Harvest
events.description: An unexpectedly good harvest provides extra food.

events.name: Stone Discovery
events.description: A new stone deposit is found nearby.

events.name: Wandering Herbalist
events.description: A traveling herbalist shares some knowledge.

events.name: Heavy Rain
events.description: Heavy rain makes gathering more difficult but provides extra water.

events.name: Tool Breakthrough
events.description: Your people develop better tools, improving gathering efficiency.

events.name: Drought
events.description: A severe drought reduces water supplies and slows gathering.

events.name: Bandit Raid
events.description: Bandits raid your settlement and steal resources.

events.name: Traveling Merchant
events.description: A wandering merchant offers useful supplies.

events.name: Minor Earthquake
events.description: An earthquake damages structures and costs some stone.

items.name: Fire
items.description: Provides heat and light, enabling cooking and survival
items.history: Controlled fire marked a key turning point, allowing early humans warmth, protection and cooked food.
items.craftingInfo: Gather dry tinder and wood, then create a spark with flint stones or friction to ignite a lasting flame.
items.puzzle: I dance and glow, giving warmth in the night. What am I?

items.name: Knife
items.description: A basic tool for various tasks
items.history: Knives are among humanity's oldest tools, first fashioned from flint or obsidian in the Stone Age.
items.craftingInfo: Shape a sharp stone or metal blade and secure it to a sturdy handle using fiber or sinew.
items.puzzle: I'm sharp and handy, cut and slice, in survival I'm worth my price.

items.name: Axe
items.description: Improves wood gathering efficiency
items.history: Axes evolved from simple stone tools into metal-headed implements during the Bronze Age.
items.craftingInfo: Bind a sharpened stone or metal head to a wooden handle, ensuring the head is secure for repeated swings.
items.puzzle: What has a handle and a head, but no arms or legs?

items.name: Shelter
items.description: Reduces resource consumption
items.history: From simple caves to wooden huts, shelters have protected humans from the elements since prehistory.
items.craftingInfo: Construct a basic frame from branches or wood and cover it with thatch, hide, or cloth to keep out the weather.
items.puzzle: I keep you safe, I keep you dry, I'm built with care, up toward the sky. What am I?

items.name: Pickaxe
items.description: Allows efficient stone and ore gathering
items.history: Metal pickaxes enabled miners to extract valuable minerals from rock, a cornerstone of ancient industry.
items.craftingInfo: Forge a pointed metal head and attach it firmly to a wooden handle to concentrate force on a small area.
items.puzzle: I have a point and a rocky mission, breaking through stone is my ambition.

items.name: Farm
items.description: Produces food over time
items.history: Early agriculture let humans settle and cultivate crops instead of roaming as hunter-gatherers.
items.craftingInfo: Clear fertile land, till the soil and plant seeds in rows. Water and tend regularly for growth.
items.puzzle: With seeds and soil, sun and rain, I help your food to grow again. What am I?

items.name: Well
items.description: Produces water over time
items.history: Wells have been dug since ancient times to reach groundwater and provide reliable supplies.
items.craftingInfo: Dig deep and line the shaft with stone or wood to prevent collapse. Use a bucket or pulley to draw water.
items.puzzle: Deep in the earth, I'm built with care, to bring up something vital and rare. What am I?

items.name: Fishing Rod
items.description: Allows fishing, providing a new food source
items.history: Simple rods with line and hook have helped humans harvest fish from rivers and seas for millennia.
items.craftingInfo: Tie strong fiber to a flexible branch and attach a small bone or metal hook at the end to catch fish.
items.puzzle: I'm long and thin, with a hook at the end, I help you catch dinner, I'm your aquatic friend.

items.name: Kiln
items.description: Allows creation of bricks and pottery
items.history: Early potters used simple kilns to harden clay vessels, paving the way for durable storage and art.
items.craftingInfo: Build an insulated chamber of stone or clay and maintain a hot fire inside to bake items placed within.
items.puzzle: I'm hot inside, turning soft to hard, with me you can shape clay, I'm a crafter's card.

items.name: Loom
items.description: Allows creation of cloth for advanced crafting
items.history: Looms revolutionized textile production in ancient civilizations by speeding up weaving.
items.craftingInfo: Create a frame that holds warp threads under tension and pass a shuttle carrying weft threads over and under them.
items.puzzle: Threads intertwine, as I work back and forth, creating fabric fine, I prove my worth.

items.name: Forge
items.description: Allows metal working for advanced tools
items.history: The development of forges enabled smiths to work iron and ushered in stronger tools and weapons.
items.craftingInfo: Construct a hearth with bellows to intensify heat. Place metal inside until it glows and hammer it into shape.
items.puzzle: Fire burns hot, metal bends to will, I shape the future, with hammer and skill.

items.name: Herbalist's Hut
items.description: Produces medicine, improving population health
items.history: Traditional healers gathered plants in simple huts where remedies were prepared for the sick.
items.craftingInfo: Build a small shelter with drying racks for herbs and a sturdy table to mix concoctions.
items.puzzle: Leaves and roots, I know their use, to heal the sick, my knowledge I produce.

items.name: Watchtower
items.description: Improves resource discovery rate
items.history: From ancient walls to medieval forts, watchtowers helped communities spot danger approaching from afar.
items.craftingInfo: Erect a tall framework of wood or stone with a sheltered platform at the top for lookouts.
items.puzzle: I stand tall and see far, guarding day and night, from my peak, everything's in sight.

items.name: Storehouse
items.description: Increases resource storage capacity
items.history: Communities built storehouses to keep food and goods dry and safe from animals and weather.
items.craftingInfo: Construct sturdy walls and a solid roof, then add shelves or bins inside for organized storage.
items.puzzle: Walls and roof, I keep things dry, your goods within, safe and spry.

items.name: Orchard
items.description: Produces fruit over time
items.history: Cultivated orchards allowed communities to harvest sweet produce season after season.
items.craftingInfo: Plant young fruit trees in rows with space to grow and provide regular water and pruning.
items.puzzle: Trees in rows, bearing sweet delight, I grow your food, from dawn to night.

items.name: Tannery
items.description: Allows creation of leather for advanced crafting
items.history: The process of tanning hides provided durable leather for clothing and equipment throughout history.
items.craftingInfo: Soak animal hides, scrape them clean and treat with tannins from bark before stretching to dry.
items.puzzle: Hides I treat, with skill and care, turning skin to leather, strong and fair.

items.name: Library
items.description: Increases knowledge generation
items.history: Libraries preserved writings and allowed scholars to share ideas from ancient times onward.
items.craftingInfo: Construct shelves to house scrolls and books and provide a quiet space for study and copying texts.
items.puzzle: Words on pages, knowledge stored, in my halls, wisdom is explored.

items.name: Pottery Workshop
items.description: Creates pottery for water storage and trading
items.puzzle: With wheel and hand, I shape the clay, creating vessels for use each day.
